tables.title: Whispers in the Dark
tables.description: Subtle warnings that something malign is near.

entries.result: Candles bend toward the party as if reaching for warmth.
Reflections lag a heartbeat behind their owners' movements.
Footsteps echo twice, once ahead and once behind.
A child's laughter comes from inside a sealed wardrobe.
Shadows stretch upward, pointing toward the ceiling.
All metal grows ice-cold and draws faintly toward a single wall.
Portrait eyes now look at the door no matter where viewers stand.
A clock chimes thirteen times; no clock is present.

tables.title: Possessed Relics
tables.description: Items with histories that refuse to stay quiet.

entries.result: A cracked mirror that shows a stranger standing behind the viewer.
A music box that plays only when the room is empty.
A diary that fills with ash-smudged handwriting whenever a lie is spoken nearby.
A lantern that burns with green flame but casts no heat.
A ring that tightens painfully when danger approaches.
A child's toy soldier that marches toward hidden passageways.
A photograph that slowly develops new figures in the background.
A teacup that rattles violently when placed near consecrated ground.
A bell with no clapper that rings when spirits answer questions.
A veil that hides the wearer's face from mirrors but not from spirits.

tables.title: Horrific Happenings
tables.description: Grim events that interrupt investigations or rituals.

entries.result: Blood drips upward from floorboards and pools on the ceiling.
A hidden choir hums a dirge that only one party member hears.
All doors slam shut and locks rust over in seconds.
A cold wind extinguishes flames and carries whispers asking for names.
A ghost reenacts their final moments, ignoring attempts to interrupt.
A swarm of moths forms a silhouette pointing toward a forgotten room.
A staircase stretches endlessly until someone recites a remembered prayer.
A corpse puppet repeats everything spoken in the room with delay.
Fingers scratch from the inside of a wall, leaving bloody grooves.
Windows show a different season outside, with a figure beckoning.

tables.title: Obstacles and Clues
tables.description: Twists that complicate ghost hunts or occult research.

entries.result: Research notes combust unless read aloud by multiple people.
The only witness now speaks in riddles that rhyme with the spirit's name.
Protective sigils smear into nonsense unless refreshed with fresh blood.
The haunting jumps between objects when direct light touches the original focus.
A local priest forbids entry unless given proof the spirits deserve rest.
Time slips: clocks rewind five minutes every time a door opens.

tables.title: Ways to End the Haunting
tables.description: Methods that can lay spirits to rest or unleash worse things.

entries.result: Bury a cherished heirloom beneath the threshold before dawn.
Invite the spirit to share a meal cooked from an old family recipe.
Break every mirror in the building while reciting their name backward.
Ring the silent bell at midnight while all witnesses hold hands.
Rebuild a destroyed piece of furniture exactly as it was.
Carry the remains to flowing water and let the current decide their fate.
Perform a lullaby taught by the oldest resident of the village.
Place salt lines in a perfect circle around the property and leave for a night.
